summary: Synthetic identity fraud—combining made-up and real information to fake an identity—is a growing concern for financial institutions, like banks, especially as their systems go digital. In response, the Social Security Administration spent $62 million on a new service to help banks verify Social Security numbers. A 2018 law required SSA to recover the cost of rolling out the service from its users. However, low participation...
title: Social Security Administration: Actions Needed to Help Ensure Success of Electronic Verification Service
